Element.name: entry
Element.description: Data type (free text or controlled vocabulary)

Element.name: DC equivalent
Element.description: Equivalent of the term in Dublin Core metadata elements

Element.name: Repeatable
Element.description: Whether the same term can be used in multiple terms (Yes or No)

Element.name: Modality
Element.description: Degree of necessity (Mandatory, Optional, Strongly Suggested, Mandatory if)

Metadata.definition: An alphanumeric identifier for the record created for the IF Repository.
Metadata.guideline: Unique project identifier given by IF repository.
Metadata.definition: The name given to the project by the Project Leader in any language.
Metadata.guideline: Enter the whole title of the project you are involved in, including any subtitle. Do not use any punctuation between the title and subtitle. Only capitalize the first alphabet of the project title, acronyms and any personal and geographic names.
Metadata.definition: The name of the Imagining Futures Project Type.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the IF project type information. Choose between from the list.
Metadata.definition: The name of the Imagining Futures Project Regions.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the IF project region information. Choose between from the list.
Metadata.definition: The name of the related project.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the name of the related project to this project. It could be Top Up or Starter project.
Metadata.definition: A textual description of the project including the aim and objectives, methods, scope and expected impacts.
Metadata.guideline: Provide textual description of the project in primary language limited to maximum of 250 words. Include background information, aim, objectives, methods and impacts of the project.
Metadata.example: In Search of LA is a digital hub for documenting histories and telling stories about Los Angeles neighborhoods, past and present. It identifies and brings together resources from across the city, including local, community-based collections, digital archives, and institutional repositories, facilitating place-based research. In Search of LA enables collaborative history-making and demystifies the research process. It serves multiple audiences and supports community-based learning at UCLA, scholarly research, and public participation in the creation of historical narratives.
Metadata.definition: A textual description of the project including the aim and objectives, methods, scope and expected impacts in another language or with different words.
Metadata.guideline: Provide a textual description of the project in an alternative language or using different words. The description should be limited to a maximum of 250 words and should include background information, the project's aim, objectives, methods, and its anticipated impacts.
Metadata.definition: The name of the Lead project investigator.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the first name and last name (surname) of the lead project investigator.
Metadata.definition: The name of the country where the project was carried out.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the name of the country where the project was carried out.
Metadata.definition: A link to the project's Imagining Futures website.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the URL of the project's IF webpage.
Metadata.definition: A link to the project's alternative website.
Metadata.guideline: Provide the URL of the project'ss external webpage.
